column4: okay, installing nvidia drivers still requires that i use the 'debian way' correct?
debian way is never required, but it's the best ;-)
hey, your look familiar, did you use to work at Gateway? ;-)
i think gumstix is pretty coo, but prolly too small for my purposes :)
i mean i COULD see uses... bluetooth with a battery sounds like cool portable storage to me, but i'd have to build a case and do the battery thing all myself :)
i can't see its uses beyond fancy remote control, mp3 player, or some device driver say like they have with the link for the epaper thingy
hmmm, seems if i add the etherstix i have no place left for storage...
so the question is what can one do with 64 of ram and 4mb of flash and ethernet? :)
Xgates is our local slackware convert, he will be optimizing down to the nanosecond :)
he jsut recompiled the kernle to his specs hehe
you know for the first time ever i haven't felt a need to build my own kernel...
i was mildly annoyed that i had to rebuild the initrd to turn off vesafb though, even though it turned out not to matter :)
